name: Avoid second order XPath injection
associatedValueName: Call stack from user input source down to the target method
description:
The software does not properly neutralize special elements that are used in XML, allowing attackers to modify the syntax, content, or commands of the XML before it is processed by an end system.

Using CAST data-flow engine, this metric detects execution paths from methods returning data coming from database down to XPath manipulation methods, paths which are open vulnerabilities to Xpath injection flaws.
output:
List all methods that make resource calls forged by database content

It provides the following information:
 - Method full name
 - Call stack from database source down to the target method.
rationale:
The software does not properly neutralize special elements that are used in XML, allowing attackers to modify the syntax, content, or commands of the XML before it is processed by an end system.

XPath injection (second order) - The application stores data in a database. At a later time, the data is subsequently read back into the application and included in XML without sanitization, allowing attackers to modify the syntax, content, or commands of the XML before it is processed by an end system.
reference:
CWE-91: XML Injection (aka Blind XPath Injection)
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/91.html

and https://owasp.org/Top10/A03_2021-Injection/
alternativeName: Ensure your application properly neutralize XML content before it is processed
